name: NPR
text:
Disney+ is strengthening its labels that warn viewers of racist depictions and overtones in some of its classic titles, like "Peter Pan" and "The Jungle Book."

The message appears before the title plays and in the program's description.
https://t.co/Q6QrCbh699

name: NPR
text:
The national debt now exceeds the size of the U.S. economy.

"Borrowing to combat the pandemic and economic crisis makes sense. But that's no excuse for the massive tax cuts and spending increases enacted before the pandemic," a fiscal policy expert says. https://t.co/O4ylLf9O9U

name: NPR
text:
Pointing to the group that plotted to kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, a disinformation expert warned House lawmakers that what happens online can have real-world consequences â€” including violence.

Republicans chose not to attend the hearing.
https://t.co/F6qt1iArOt

name: NPR
text:
Mac Phipps fights for his freedom in court, @louderthanariot looks at the history of Black music being weaponized against its artist and the use of lyrics in court cases.

PLUS: A new witness to the shooting comes forward to NPR.

LISTEN:
https://t.co/cOIhodRMG2 https://t.co/3YgkKUFvgA

name: NPR
text:
A new report by the nonprofit Public Citizen is calling out major retailers â€” including Walmart, Target, Best Buy and Lowe's â€” for donating to trade groups and campaigns promoting harsher shoplifting penalties in at least 18 states.
https://t.co/iHF2RqgrwD

name: NPR
text: Barack Obama will hit the campaign trail for Joe Biden in its final weeks after mostly staying out of the race â€” though he did describe Trump as a failure as president and a threat to democracy during his DNC speech. https://t.co/w04D1na63W

name: NPR
text:
Police in Bangkok used water cannons to disperse protesters a day after the government banned demonstrations calling for the resignation of Thailand's prime minister, reform of its monarchy, and a new constitution. 
https://t.co/lm3RFSzsAP

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration has announced a new, opt-in program for nursing homes that would have pharmacies deliver and administer a future coronavirus vaccine on site.
https://t.co/9PoTVnydWE

name: NPR
text:
California appears to be backing off legal threats against the state's Republican Party over its use of unauthorized ballot drop boxes.
 https://t.co/gelIrLjFNo

name: NPR
text:
